theorem putnam_1968_a5
(V : Set ℝ[X])
(V_def : V = {P : ℝ[X] | P.degree = 2 ∧ ∀ x ∈ Set.Icc 0 1, |P.eval x| ≤ 1})
: sSup {|(derivative P).eval 0| | P ∈ V} = putnam_1968_a5_solution := by
  have h₁ : sSup {|(derivative P).eval 0| | P ∈ V} = 8 := by
    have h₂ : ∃ P ∈ V, |(derivative P).eval 0| = 8 := by
      use Polynomial.X ^ 2 + 4 * Polynomial.X + 3
      constructor
      · -- Prove that this polynomial is in V
        simp [V_def, Polynomial.degree_X_pow, Polynomial.degree_add_eq_left_of_degree_lt,
          Polynomial.degree_C]
        <;> norm_num
        <;>
        norm_cast
        <;>
        intro x hx
        <;>
        norm_num [Set.mem_Icc] at hx ⊢
        <;>
        cases' hx with hx₁ hx₂
        <;>
        rw [abs_le]
        <;>
        constructor <;>
        nlinarith [sq_nonneg (x - 1), sq_nonneg (x + 1)]
      · -- Prove that the derivative at 0 is 8
        simp [Polynomial.derivative_add, Polynomial.derivative_mul, Polynomial.derivative_pow,
          Polynomial.derivative_X, Polynomial.derivative_C, abs_of_nonneg, le_of_lt]
        <;>
        norm_num
        <;>
        norm_cast
        <;>
        simp_all [abs_of_nonneg, le_of_lt]
        <;>
        nlinarith
    have h₃ : ∀ P ∈ V, |(derivative P).eval 0| ≤ 8 := by
      intro P hP
      rcases hP with ⟨hP_degree, hP_bounds⟩
      have hP_deriv : P.derivative.degree ≤ 1 := by
        -- The derivative of a quadratic polynomial is at most a linear polynomial
        simp_all [Polynomial.degree_derivative_le]
        <;>
        aesop
      have hP_deriv_coe : P.derivative.natDegree ≤ 1 := by
        -- The derivative of a quadratic polynomial is at most a linear polynomial
        simp_all [Polynomial.natDegree_le_of_degree_le]
        <;>
        aesop
      have hP_deriv_form : ∃ a b : ℝ, P.derivative = Polynomial.C a * Polynomial.X + Polynomial.C b := by
        -- Any linear polynomial can be expressed in the form aX + b
        refine' ⟨P.derivative.coeff 1, P.derivative.coeff 0, _⟩
        rw [eq_X_add_C_of_natDegree_le_one hP_deriv_coe]
        <;>
        aesop
      rcases hP_deriv_form with ⟨a, b, hP_deriv_eq⟩
      rw [hP_deriv_eq]
      simp [abs_le]
      norm_num
      have hP_bounds_0 := hP_bounds 0 (by norm_num)
      have hP_bounds_1 := hP_bounds 1 (by norm_num)
      simp [abs_le] at hP_bounds_0 hP_bounds_1 ⊢
      constructor <;> nlinarith [sq_nonneg a, sq_nonneg b, sq_nonneg (a + b), sq_nonneg (a - b)]
    have h₄ : sSup {|(derivative P).eval 0| | P ∈ V} ≤ 8 := by
      apply csSup_le
      · use 0
        simp_all
        <;> aesop
      · intro P hP
        simp_all
        <;> aesop
    have h₅ : sSup {|(derivative P).eval 0| | P ∈ V} ≥ 8 := by
      have h₅₁ : 8 ∈ {|(derivative P).eval 0| | P ∈ V} := by
        obtain ⟨P, hP⟩ := h₂
        aesop
      exact csSup_le_iff.mpr ⟨8, by aesop⟩
    linarith
  
  simp_all [putnam_1968_a5_solution]
  <;> aesop

theorem putnam_1968_a5
(V : Set ℝ[X])
(V_def : V = {P : ℝ[X] | P.degree = 2 ∧ ∀ x ∈ Set.Icc 0 1, |P.eval x| ≤ 1})
: sSup {|(derivative P).eval 0| | P ∈ V} = putnam_1968_a5_solution := by

    have h₁ : ∃ P : ℝ[X], P ∈ V ∧ |(derivative P).eval 0| = 8 := by

      constructor
      · -- Prove that the polynomial X^2 - 4 * X + 3 is in V
        simp only [V_def, Set.mem_setOf_eq, Polynomial.degree_X_pow, Polynomial.degree_mul,
          Polynomial.degree_C, Polynomial.degree_X, Polynomial.degree_one, Nat.cast_ofNat]
        norm_num
        <;>
        (try
          norm_num) <;>
          (try
            intro x hx
            norm_num [abs_le]
            <;>
            constructor <;>
            nlinarith [hx.1, hx.2]) <;>
          (try
            simp_all [Set.Icc, abs_le]) <;>
          (try
            nlinarith)
      · -- Prove that the absolute value of the derivative at 0 is 8
        norm_num [abs_eq_max_neg, Polynomial.derivative_X_pow, Polynomial.derivative_mul,
          Polynomial.derivative_add, Polynomial.derivative_sub, Polynomial.derivative_C,
          Polynomial.derivative_X, Polynomial.eval_sub, Polynomial.eval_mul, Polynomial.eval_add,
          Polynomial.eval_pow, Polynomial.eval_C, Polynomial.eval_X]
        <;>
        norm_num
        <;>
        rfl
    have h₂ : ∀ P : ℝ[X], P ∈ V → |(derivative P).eval 0| ≤ 8 := by
      intro P hP
      simp only [V_def, Set.mem_setOf_eq] at hP
      have h₃ : P.degree = 2 := hP.1
      have h₄ : ∀ x ∈ Set.Icc (0 : ℝ) 1, |P.eval x| ≤ 1 := hP.2
      have h₅ : |(derivative P).eval 0| ≤ 8 := by

        have h₆ : (derivative P).eval 0 = P.eval 0 := by
          simp [derivative_eval]

          simp_all [Polynomial.eval_two, Polynomial.eval_add, Polynomial.eval_sub, Polynomial.eval_mul,
            Polynomial.eval_pow, Polynomial.eval_C, Polynomial.eval_X]
          <;>
          nlinarith
        rw [h₆]
        have h₇ : |P.eval 0| ≤ 1 := by
          apply h₄ 0 (by norm_num)
        cases' le_total 0 (P.eval 0) with h₈ h₈ <;>

          nlinarith [sq_nonneg (P.eval 0 - 1), sq_nonneg (P.eval 0 + 1)]
      exact h₅
    exact?

  <;>
  norm_num
  <;>
  aesop

(V_def : V = {P : ℝ[X] | P.degree = 2 ∧ ∀ x ∈ Set.Icc 0 1, |P.eval x| ≤ 1})

    have h₂ : ∃ P : ℝ[X], P ∈ V ∧ |(derivative P).eval 0| = 8 := by

      constructor
      · -- Show that -X^2 + 1 is in V
        rw [V_def]
        constructor
        · -- Show that degree of -X^2 + 1 is 2
          simp [Polynomial.degree_X_pow, Polynomial.degree_neg, Polynomial.degree_one]
        · -- Show that |(-X^2 + 1).eval x| ≤ 1 for all x in [0, 1]
          intro x hx
          simp [abs_le, hx]
          norm_num
          constructor
          · -- Show that -x^2 + 1 ≥ -1
            nlinarith [hx.1, hx.2]
          · -- Show that -x^2 + 1 ≤ 1
            nlinarith [hx.1, hx.2]

          simp [abs_le]
          norm_num
          constructor <;>

    linarith
  exact h₁
